title: I'm From Iowa
name: I'm From Iowa
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

I was born in Fort Dodge and lived there until I graduated high school.

properties.name: Community Pizza & Tap
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   2026 5th Avenue South, Fort Dodge, IA, 50501Community Pizza & Tap. Probably the best pizza in town. Also a fine drinking establishment. I wonder if they still have a pool table. Great deep-fried gizzards.

properties.name: Deep-Fried Chicken Gizzards
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Fort Dodge, IAThere are many restaurants in Fort Dodge serving deep-fried chicken gizzards. I grew up on gizzards. I love gizzards. Gizzards, gizzards, gizzards.

properties.name: Early Days
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1325 6th ave so, fort Dodge, IA

properties.name: Holy Rosary
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 2406 9 1/2 Ave S, Fort Dodge, IA 50501"My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring? O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent." That was my favorite psalm in third grade.

properties.name: I Drank Lighter Fluid
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing1315 6th Ave S, Fort Dodge, IAWhen I was four years old, I climbed up the kitchen cupboards like a ladder to the ones all the way up against the ceiling, where I found a bottle of lighter fluid and decided to give it a sip. I don\'t remember any of this first part. I fell from up near the ceiling, probably about ten feet, catching my brow on the edge of the counter on my way down. I have a scar from that. I was rushed to the hospital. I had a fever so high that I was laid in ice. My first memories of my life are the hallucinations I had while in the hospital after almost poisoning myself. There were a lot of spiders. I remember being hysterical when the gamble bug (a cartoon character whose bite compelled a black cat to play cards and with whom I was slightly fascinated) theatened me in my hospital crib.

properties.name: I Hated Marching Band
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing819 n 25th st, fort dodge, iaI played tenor sax. It\'s a heavy instrument. I also hated going to football games and I hated wearing the tall, hairy hat. I liked being in the school band, but we were all required to also play in the marching band. I quit band after sophomore year.

properties.name: Oleson Park Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Oleson Park ZooBehind a high chain-link fence live a bunch of tame animals. You can feed them bread through the fence and walk all around the vast pen, through the woods and past the band shell. Weirdest animal: several albino white-tailed deer.

properties.name: Rode Smack Into the Back of a Parked Car
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing I didn\'t know what hit me....er, what I hitI was probably about 10. I was headed tto the Kwik Shop to get my mom something. Milk or cigarettes or something like that. It was a short ride. Our little neighborhood hardly gets any traffic. I was just slowly pedaling along and I somehow got very deep indeed into a daydream. I remember that I was also watching the pavement move beneath me, something I used to do a lot when I was a kid. All of this while riding my bike. I was worlds away. I was probably not even really inside my own body anymore, mechanically pedaling my daydream forward. Then, suddenly, I was sitting on the trunk of a parked car. I had been so deep in my thoughts that at first I thought that I had been hit by a moving car. When I realized that I had actually just ran into the back of a parked car and been tossed (fairly gently, I wasn\'t going very fast) onto the car\'s trunk, my first reaction was to look around and check if anyone had seen me do it. I felt exposed and embarassed. The bike was fine. I was fine, though it is always jarring to be yanked out of your own reality into "real" reality so violently. I felt oddly ashamed and didn\'t ever tell anyone about this accident until I was in my 20s.

properties.name: Sledding Hill- Mason Drive
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This used to be a pretty good sledding hill when I was a kid, but now there\'s a fence blocking access to it and it\'s all overgrown with trees.

properties.name: Taco TICO Mexican Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 319 South 29th Street, Fort Dodge, IA, 50501This was my absolute favorite restaurant as a kid. I used to get cheese enchiladas with extra hot sauce and taco burgers. The best are the deep-fried sugar-and-cinnamon-coated crispy breads they serve for dessert. Oh, I was also rather fond of the refried beans and chips. I haven\'t eaten here in years. I used to skip out of school at lunch time with Jenny Johl, who was pretty much the only friend I had who had the balls to skip school with me ever. We\'d come to to Taco Tico and gorge ourselves on fast food and the sweet taste of liberty while playing Billy Idol\'s "White Wedding" on the juke box. Then we\'d usually just go back to school in time for our afternoon class.

properties.name: Wanna's Won-Ton Inn
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 425 2nd Ave South, Fort Dodge, IAThis was one of my favorite places to eat as a teenager. I loved it\'s name, and the fact that it was up the street from the equally alliterative "Bob\'s Burgers" which closed down but then reopened as "Patty\'s Patties." Anyhow, I was always attracted to foreign things when I was growing up in Iowa, and I had a crush on one of the young Thai men who I eyed through the kitchen window. The draw of wannas had nothing to do with won ton. They served a cheap all-you-could-eat buffet of the most fantastic deep-fried chicken I\'ve ever eaten accompanied by bread deep-fried in the same fat as the chickens. WOW. There were always a lot of fat people in there. Great and greasy.
